name: Eat Michigan Salad
author: Saveur
summary: I live in Buckeye country, that's the land of Ohio State University football to the rest of you. We love to tailgate and watch the Bowl games, and are always trying to come up with clever things to do to our biggest rivals up north, the Michigan Wolverines. The cherries and maple in this wonderful salad inspired the name. Enjoy!
ingredients: 3 heads butter lettuce - rinsed, and torn
2  Granny Smith apples, cored and cut into matchsticks
directions: In the container of a blender, combine the mayonnaise, maple syrup, vinegar, and sugar
Cover and blend on low speed
Gradually pour in the vegetable oil while mixing until fully incorporated
Taste and season accordingly with salt and pepper
In a large serving bowl, combine the lettuce, cherries, apples, goat cheese and candied pecans
Toss with just enough of the dressing to coat, then serve with the remaining dressing on the side
